item.title: Wannabe cop a child sex fiend
item.description: A man who dreamt of joining the police force will instead spend time in prison after he was caught by his heroes grooming children for sex.

item.title: How ’freedom walk’ protests are spreading
item.description: Illegal anti-lockdown “freedom walk” protests are spreading across Melbourne as unrest grows over the tough lockdown measures imposed on the city.

item.title: Kidnap accused wants ‘care leave’
item.description: One of the men accused of the violent kidnapping of an Ipswich businessman and his model girlfriend needs to be released to care for his pregnant partner, a court has been told.

item.title: Captive shoppers flock to online retailer
item.description: Online furniture and homewares group Temple & Webster is the latest company to report an ongoing surge in customer numbers as more Australians try e-commerce for the first time during the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: 10 new cases of COVID in NSW
item.description: There have been 10 new cases of coronavirus diagnosed in New South Wales up to 8pm on Sunday night.

item.title: John Howard out of hospital
item.description: Former Australian prime minister John Howard has been released from hospital after having emergency surgery on Monday last week.

item.title: Crows rookie faces driving charges
item.description: Adelaide Crows AFL rookie Tyson Stengle must appear in court after he was allegedly caught drink driving in an unregistered car while disqualified earlier this year.

item.title: Magic number that will end lockdown
item.description: Victoria’s chief health officer expects coronavirus cases to be at the 40-50 mark by the end of the week, when Melburnians can expect to hear highly sought-after details on a “road map” out of stage four lockdown.

item.title: Cadaver dogs in cold case murder hunt
item.description: Police are searching a property with cadaver dogs as investigations ramp up into the suspected murder of a Gold Coast mum in 2012.

item.title: Coffee snob fined for virus breach
item.description: A Melbourne coffee snob has been fined for breaching coronavirus restrictions after being busted more than 5km from home.
